metadata.title: CVE-2016-10517 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
networking.c in Redis before 3.2.7 allows "Cross Protocol Scripting"because it lacks a check for POST and Host: strings, which are not valid inthe Redis protocol (but commonly occur when an attack triggers an HTTPrequest to the Redis TCP port).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10517` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

redis-sentinel - 4:4.0.1-7
redis-server - 4:4.0.1-7
redis-tools - 4:4.0.1-7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: redis package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4:4.0.1-7').
